jparsec.ephem.stars

Class StarEphemElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.stars.StarEphemElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StarEphemElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Convenient class for star ephem data access.

    This class provides access to the data resulting from the calculation of ephemerides of stars.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • rightAscension

        public double rightAscension
        Right Ascension in radians.

      • declination

        public double declination
        Declination in radians.

      • distance

        public double distance
        Distance to the observer in pc.

      • magnitude

        public float magnitude
        Apparent magnitude.

      • paralacticAngle

        public float paralacticAngle
        Paralactic angle in radians.

      • azimuth

        public double azimuth
        Azimuth in radians.

      • elevation

        public double elevation
        Geometric/apparent elevation in radians.

      • rise

        public double rise
        Rise time as a julian day in local time. If the object is above the horizon, then the value will be refered to the current day, otherwise it will be the next rise event in time.

      • set

        public double set
        Set time as a julian day in local time. If the object is above the horizon, then the value will be refered to the current day, otherwise it will be the next set event in time.

      • transit

        public double transit
        Transit time as a julian day in local time. If the object is above the horizon, then the value will be refered to the current day, otherwise it will be the next transit event in time.

      • transitElevation

        public float transitElevation
        Transit geometrical elevation from horizon in radians.

      • constellation

        public java.lang.String constellation
        Constellation where the object is located.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Name of the star.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StarEphemElement

        public StarEphemElement(double ra,
                double dec,
                double r,
                float mag,
                float paralactic,
                double azi,
                double altitude)
        Constructs an star ephem object providing the values of the fields. This sets the values of all the fields except light rise, set, transit, transit elevation, and constellation.
        Parameters:
        ra - Right Ascension in radians.
        dec - Declination in radians.
        r - Distance to the observer in AU.
        mag - Apparent magnitude.
        paralactic - Paralactic angle in radians.
        azi - Azimuth in radians.
        altitude - Elevation in radians.

      • StarEphemElement

        public StarEphemElement()
        Constructs an empty star ephem object.

    • Method Detail

      • getEquatorialLocation

        public LocationElement getEquatorialLocation()
        Returns the equatorial location of this object. Radius vector is in pc, but it is set to unity in case distance is 0.
        Returns:
        The location in equatorial system.
